H0.text: Uranium is the material from which fossil fuels were formed.

H1.text: Sea water is what fossil fuels were formed from.

H2.text: Sand and gravel are the substances from which fossil fuels were formed.

H3.text: Dead plants and animals formed fossil fuels.

A4.text: The origin of fossil fuels is the anaerobic decomposition of buried dead organisms.

A5.text: The conversion of dead vegetation into coal is called coalification.

A6.text: Vast deposits of coal originate in former wetlands called coal forests that covered much of the Earth's tropical land areas during the late Carboniferous (Pennsylvanian) and Permian times.
